net.openhft.chronicle.decentred.dto.base

Interface SignedMessage

  • All Superinterfaces:
    net.openhft.chronicle.bytes.BytesMarshallable, net.openhft.chronicle.bytes.ReadBytesMarshallable, net.openhft.chronicle.bytes.WriteBytesMarshallable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ApplicationErrorResponse, AssignDelegatesRequest, CreateAddressEvent, CreateAddressRequest, CreateChainRequest, CreateTokenRequest, EndOfRoundBlockEvent, InvalidationEvent, SelfSignedMessage, TransactionBlockEvent, TransactionBlockGossipEvent, TransactionBlockVoteEvent, VanillaSignedMessage, VerificationEvent

    public interface SignedMessage
extends net.openhft.chronicle.bytes.BytesMarshallable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long address()
      Returns a unique address for the sender.
      int messageType()
      Returns the message type for this message.
      int protocol()
      Returns the protocol for this message.
      net.openhft.chronicle.bytes.BytesStore publicKey()
      Returns the public key if it is embedded in the message.
      SignedMessage sign(net.openhft.chronicle.bytes.BytesStore secretKey)
      Signs and returns this message.
      boolean signed()
      Returns if this message is signed.
      long timestampUS()
      Returns a microsecond precision, unique monotonically increasing timestamp

      • Methods inherited from interface net.openhft.chronicle.bytes.BytesMarshallable

        $toString, readMarshallable, writeMarshallable

    • Method Detail

      • protocol

        int protocol()
        Returns the protocol for this message.

        The protocol is stored as an unsigned short 1-65,536)

        Returns:
        the protocol for this message

      • messageType

        int messageType()
        Returns the message type for this message.

        The message type is stored as an unsigned short (1-65,536)

        Returns:
        the message type for this message

      • signed

        boolean signed()
        Returns if this message is signed. Once a message is signed it can't be modified, only read.

        It cannot be sent until it is signed.

        Returns:
        true if signed, false if not signed

      • address

        long address()
        Returns a unique address for the sender. This should be the last 8 bytes of the public key.
        Returns:
        a unique id for this server.

      • timestampUS

        long timestampUS()
        Returns a microsecond precision, unique monotonically increasing timestamp

        NOTE: If the writing system doesn't have a micro-second accurate clock, the most accurate clock should be used and increment the timestamp in the cause of any collision

        Returns:
        a unique microsecond timestamp for an address. Must be monotonically increasing.

      • publicKey

        net.openhft.chronicle.bytes.BytesStore publicKey()
        Returns the public key if it is embedded in the message. If no such public key is embedded, returns a ByteStore of length zero.
        Returns:
        the public key if it is embedded in the message.

      • sign

        SignedMessage sign(net.openhft.chronicle.bytes.BytesStore secretKey)
        Signs and returns this message. As an additional side effect, also sets the public key (if any) and address in this message.
        Parameters:
        secretKey - to sign this message with.
        Returns:
        this signed message
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided secretKey is null
